page.title: 12Pocket Money
page.content:
In my house a regular event each Friday is my dad giving pocket money to my sister and I. Pocket money is our spending money for the week, and I have been given pocket money for as long as I can remember. One of the good things about my birthday is that I get a rise in my pocket money. At the moment I am given Â£2.50p per week and my sister who is two years younger than I, receives Â£2.00.
74% of people receive pocket money 10% of people have part time jobs and receive wages instead of pocket money. 16% don't receive a set amount of pocket money but ask their parents when they want money for something.
/cont'd
